data.name: Jando Giant's Causeway Large Frame
data.description: The Giant's Causeway is an area of about 4.000 interlocking basalt column. the result of an ancient volcanic fissure eruption. It is located in County Antrim on the north coast of Northern Irelan. about three miles northeast of the town of Bushmills. The tops of the columns form stepping stones that lead from the cliff foot and disappear under the sea. Most of the columns are hexagona. although there are also some with fou. fiv. seven or eight sides. The tallest are about 12 metres hig. and the solidified lava in the cliffs is 28 metres thick in places.297mm x 420. data.name: Jando Dublin Town GPO Large Frame
data.description: The General Post Office is one of the most interesting buildings in Dublin. It’s not just one of the most elegant buildings in Dubli. with its six imposing Ionic column. it was the last of the great Georgian public buildings of its kind erected in Dublin. The GPO was the main stronghold for the Irish volunteers during The Rising and came under heavy attack. As a resul. the building was destroyed by fire but was rebuilt many years later the Irish Free State government. Bullet holes are still visible in the columns to this day. Today the building functions as the headquarters of An Pos. the Irish Postal Service.297mm x 420. Designed and printed in our Dublin studi. each print is hand signed to guarantee authenticity.

data.name: Jando Giant's Causeway Mount
data.description: The Giant's Causeway is an area of about 4.000 interlocking basalt column. the result of an ancient volcanic fissure eruption. It is located in County Antrim on the north coast of Northern Irelan. about three miles northeast of the town of Bushmills. The tops of the columns form stepping stones that lead from the cliff foot and disappear under the sea. Most of the columns are hexagona. although there are also some with fou. fiv. seven or eight sides. The tallest are about 12 metres hig. and the solidified lava in the cliffs is 28 metres thick in places.A4 Prin. Designed and printed in Jando's Dublin studi. each print is hand signed to guarantee authenticity

data.name: Jando Cliffs of Moher Mount
data.description: The Cliffs of Moher are sea cliffs located at the southwestern edge of the Burren region in County Clar. Ireland. At their southern en. they rise 120 metres above the Atlantic Ocean at Hag's Hea. an. eight kilometres to the nort. reach their maximum height of 214 metres just north of O'Brien's Towe. a round stone tower near the midpoint of the cliff. built in 1835 by Sir Cornelius O'Brien. From the cliff. and from atop the towe. visitors can see the Aran Islands in Galway Ba. the Maumturks and Twelve Pins mountain ranges to the north in County Galwa. and Loop Head to the south.A4 Prin. Designed and printed in our Dublin studi. each print is hand signed to guarantee authenticity

data.name: Jando Dublin Town Howth Lighthouse Mount
data.description: Guarding the entrance to Howth Harbour is the distinctive Howth Harbour Lighthouse with it’s signature Georgian house attached. The building is steeped in history having served as lighthouse from 181. a lighthouse keeper’s residence until the introduction of electricity in 195. a defensive stronghold taking advantage of it’s strong circular wall and it was even used as a landing point for weapons for the Irish Volunteers by author Erskine Childers in 1914.A4 Prin. data.name: Stephen Farnan Small Frame By Hook Or By Crook
data.description: There's a little bit of artistic licence in 'By Hook or by Crook' as they are actually miles apart... It's thought the expression dates from the days of the first Norman invasions of Irelan. when rudimentary sailing boats left from Bristol or Pembroke bound for Ireland. The first Norman king of Ireland was Richard III. Back in his da. depending on the weathe. the voyage to Ireland could be extremely hazardous and many ships didn’t make it. For the Norman. the two most extreme points on the Irish southern coast with harbour's where they could possibly dock were Hook Head in Wexford to the eas. and Crookhaven in Cork to the west. If you failed to make land between Hook and Croo. you were going off towards the wild Atlantic and the treacherous west coas. where the seas were hug. the ports fe. and the native Irish not too friendly to the hapless Normans. Therefor. the Normans vowed to land in Ireland “by hook or by crook” and deploy any means necessary to do s. because to miss the stretch between Hook Head and Crookhaven meant the voyage was a total failure.26.5cm x 26.5c. Comes presented in a gift bo. Made in Ireland

data.name: Jando Giant's Causeway Small Frame
data.description: The Giant's Causeway is an area of about 4.000 interlocking basalt column. the result of an ancient volcanic fissure eruption. It is located in County Antrim on the north coast of Northern Irelan. about three miles northeast of the town of Bushmills. The tops of the columns form stepping stones that lead from the cliff foot and disappear under the sea. Most of the columns are hexagona. although there are also some with fou. fiv. seven or eight sides. The tallest are about 12 metres hig. and the solidified lava in the cliffs is 28 metres thick in places.210mm x 297m. Designed and printed in our Dublin studi. each print is hand signed to guarantee authenticity

Cashel is reputed to be the site of the conversion of the King of Munster by St. Patrick in the 5th century. Having been the traditional seat of the kings of Munster for several hundred years prior to the in 110. the King of Munste. Muirchertach Ua Briai. donated his fortress on the Rock to the Church.
